intro: Zaluzianskia marsilioides, commonly known as the Marsilea water clover, is a floating aquatic plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its small, four-leaf clover-like leaves that float on the water surface. The plant has slender, branching stems that root in the sediment at the bottom of water bodies. It is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Zaluzianskia marsilioides plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms and contributing to water filtration.
